sentences.english: That is why it is healthy for everybody to be afraid of height.
sentences.chinese: 這就是爲什麼正常人都是畏高的。

sentences.english: Your son sets low personal standards and then consistently fails to achieve them.
sentences.chinese: 令郎自設低於常人的標準，又老是達不到。

sentences.english: And remind yourself that parents are people too.
sentences.chinese: 提醒自己父母也是平常人。
他能忍常人不能忍受的。

sentences.english: The new American mood was, if anything, eminently commercial.
sentences.chinese: 新的美國情節意味着，純粹的，異乎常人的商業頭腦。

sentences.english: The expression of these antigens may change with the change of their functions.
sentences.chinese: 研究正常人表皮內朗格漢斯細胞的抗原表達。

sentences.english: Hematuria in patients with high blood pressure is higher than normal acid normal.
sentences.chinese: 高血壓患者的血尿酸水平常高於正常人。

sentences.english: Conclusion There was an obviously difference of the correlational language cortex between subjects and patients with temporal epilepsy.
sentences.chinese: 結論癲癇病人的語言相關腦區與正常人有明顯的差異。
完全是些常人不可理解的東西。

sentences.english: Our goal is to make life as normal as possible for people with paralysis.
sentences.chinese: 我們的目標是使癱瘓的人擁有跟正常人一樣的生活。

sentences.english: It's okay to fly but it is a pain on very long flights or when there is bad turbulence.
sentences.chinese: 坐飛機還好，關頭是飛颶久挺常人的，或者趕上氣流。

sentences.english: God wants you to go beyond the normal and surpass what is required of you.
sentences.chinese: 上帝想讓你超出正常人，超越你被要求的那個樣子。

sentences.english: A bohemian is a person who is interested in art and lives an unconventional lifestyle.
sentences.chinese: 是指喜歡藝術且生活方式異於常人的人。

sentences.english: The brains of those with mild cognitive impairment shrink twice as fast.
sentences.chinese: 輕度認知障礙者的腦萎縮速率爲正常人的二倍。

sentences.english: As well as being feared, the Chinese are admired for being cleverer than everybody else.
sentences.chinese: 這些比平常人更聰明的中國人讓人又畏又羨。

sentences.english: Sanmao lives in a dreamy world as compared to common people.
sentences.chinese: 三毛生活在一個對常人來說如同夢境的世界裏。

definition: ordinary person/private citizen/people/the person in the street
peer/one's contemporary/person of the same age
to compare/to draw a parallel/to match/analogy/metaphor/comparison
to hope to reach/to strive for
